definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
Children's Day (June 1st), PRC national holiday for children under 14
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
Arbor Day (March 12th), also known as National Tree Planting Day 全民義務植樹日|全民义务植树日[Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4]
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
make your day's plan early in the morning (idiom)/early morning is the golden time of the day

definition: millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
